captionText: Birthdays are nature's way of telling us to eat more cake.
author: Unknown

captionText: Age is merely the number of years the world has been enjoying you. Happy birthday!
author: Unknown

captionText: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream. Happy birthday!
author: C.S. Lewis

captionText: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
author: John Lennon

captionText: Birthdays are good for you. Statistics show that the more you have, the longer you live!
author: Unknown

captionText: Birthdays are like cheese. They stink more the older they get.
author: Unknown

captionText: Don't count the years. Count the blessings. Happy birthday!
author: Unknown

captionText: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
author: Oprah Winfrey

captionText: Wrinkles should merely indicate where the smiles have been.
author: Mark Twain

captionText: Live your life and forget your age. Happy birthday!
author: Norman Vincent Peale

captionText: Aging is the only way to live a long life.
author: Kitty Collins

captionText: Birthdays are a great time to stop and appreciate gravity. Sure, it makes things sag as you get older, but it also keeps your cake from flying all over the room, so you don’t have to chase it.
author: Greg Tamblyn

captionText: Youth is a gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

captionText: Growing old is mandatory, but growing up is optional.
author: Walt Disney

captionText: With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come.
author: William Shakespeare

captionText: Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.
author: Dr. Seuss

captionText: Don't just count your years, make your years count.
author: George Meredith

captionText: Another adventure filled year awaits you. Welcome it by celebrating your birthday with pomp and splendor. Wishing you a very happy and fun-filled birthday!
author: Unknown

captionText: Age is a case of mind over matter. If you don’t mind, it don’t matter.
author: Satchel Paige

captionText: Birthdays are good for you. The more you have, the longer you live.
author: Unknown

captionText: Age is not how old you are, but how many years of fun you’ve had.
author: Matt Maldre

captionText: May the joy that you have spread in the past come back to you on this day. Wishing you a very happy birthday!
author: Unknown

captionText: A birthday is like a new year and my wish for you, is a great year full of happiness and sunshine!
author: Catherine Pulsifer

captionText: Let us never know what old age is. Let us know the happiness time brings, not count the years.
author: Ausonius

captionText: Life seems to fade our memory, so on this birthday, I will forget yours if you forget mine!
author: Unknown

captionText: To me, old age is always 15 years older than I am.
author: Bernard Baruch

captionText: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
author: Lucille Ball

captionText: We are always the same age inside.
author: Gertrude Stein

captionText: You are only young once, but you can be immature for a lifetime.
author: John P. Grier

captionText: Birthdays are good for you. Statistics show that people who have the most live the longest.
author: Larry Lorenzoni

captionText: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

captionText: Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

captionText: Middle age is when you're sitting at home on a Saturday night and the telephone rings and you hope it isn't for you.
author: Ogden Nash

captionText: Birthdays are nature's way of telling us to eat more cake.
author: Unknown
